maybe mvn clean install -DskipTests -Pcommunity and you can skip te second mvn clean install down below here

PROFILE=LRA ./scripts/hudson/narayana.sh

./scripts/hudson/narayana-rebase.sh

nodes.bodyText:
@tomjenkinson without clean rebase the GH actions won't run. Please check the example at xstefank#5. So I don't think narayana-rebase.sh is necessary.
About PROFILE=LRA ./scripts/hudson/narayana.sh this job was created precisely to test in different environment with different settings so for instance avoiding -Dlra.tck.timeout.factor=1.5 from this script. Also GH actions will set PR status directly on PR so no need for comments. It is easier to keep only the command for now. If we are to move the whole CI from Hudson here then it will make sense to reuse the scripts with adjustments. But now it would be just overhead. Sorry, if I'm missing something in the scripts. In that case please point me to the correct configuration and I'll change it in the PR. But now I would like to avoid setting a bunch of environment properties to run a single script that runs essentially single command.

nodes.bodyText:
Do I understand that this will rebase before running the testing somehow because of GH Actions?
The narayana-rebase.sh actually does a rebase so we can be sure the PR is running with the latest changes.
If that is the case then we don't need the narayana-rebase.sh

nodes.bodyText:
It won't run the actions before you solve all the conflicts. So it basically forces you to rebase. It's true that clean rebase without conflicts could help with many merges in short periods but that will rarely happen I think and we will still be running hudson jobs this is just parallel testing for the timing issues. It won't be easy to set GH actions according to your hudson setup. This would be just a start and if there is a requirement to migrate everything, including scripts, we can do that later in a separate JBTM.
The scripts require some environment properties that aren't configurable per run in GH actions.

nodes.bodyText: The automatic rebasing of PRs has a purpose in that if an unrelated defect is fixed and merged, it doesn't require the PR author to rebase manually and the project team can just re-run the PR.

nodes.bodyText: There isn't a possibility to run the full test suite. The issue is with the tests in lra-coordinator-jar module because they require full WFLY server which is not downloaded or included during the builds. As mentioned above this is just a quick setup mainly for TCK (but also includes basic test suite) so we can catch timing issues in the Hudson CI. We will build on top of this if necessary later. I am not sure if Narayana team would want to migrate all testing to GH actions.

nodes.bodyText:
In this branch of the discussion I am discussing if we weren't to use narayana.sh. So in this case it would be something like changing the line mvn clean install -Parg to (I guess, based on the path): ../../../build.sh clean install -Parq (or remove the cd and go with ./build.sh -f rts/lra/lra-test/pom.xml clean install -Parq
It's not very clear to me where the mvn is coming from in the command as it stands, maybe it's part of ubuntu-latest? I think for reproducibility though we should be using the Maven in narayana: https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/tree/master/tools/maven by calling https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/build.sh
Does that help clarify?

+    - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+    - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+      uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+      with:
+        java-version: 1.8
+    - name: Cache local Maven repository
+      uses: actions/cache@v2
+      with:
+        path: ~/.m2/repository
+        key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+        restore-keys: |
+          ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+    - name: LRA test
+      run: |
+        git config --global user.name "jbosstm"
+        git config --global user.email "jbosstm@users.noreply.github.com"

nodes.bodyText:
Sure, but by it not being the default (can a default really be established but the output from the command seems possible to consider as such) could it be perceived as not irrelevant and somehow meaningful?
I don't think this should block the PR as it could be changed later I suppose, but it's a question.

nodes.bodyText:
I tend to agree with tom (jbosstm@users.noreply.github.com implies a real email but you@example.com does not). But this job is for internal use so the change is only a "nice to have" item and need not block merging the PR.
It looks like we are all in agreement to merge the PR so provided we don't need to do anything for this last item I think we should merge and begin acquiring some data about whether the PR improves upon the rate of false positive we are seeing with our internal CI job.
